description:
An open-source ebook reader designed for immersive and deep reading experiences.

Readest is a modern, feature-rich ebook reader designed for avid readers offering seamless cross-platform access, powerful tools, and an intuitive interface to elevate your reading experience.
Release Highlight
- Reader: Improved chapter detection with better chapter title recognition
- Reader: Enhanced compatibility for parsing more footnote formats
- Theme: Fixed auto theme switching in new reader windows
- TTS: Improved scrolling accuracy to highlighted text during read-aloud
- TTS: Fixed crash issues on certain Android systems
What's Changed
- txt: add chapter title pattern, closes #2232 by @chrox in https://github.com/readest/readest/pull/2233
- compat: support parsing more footnotes, closes #2234 by @chrox in https://github.com/readest/readest/pull/2237
- fix(theme): fixed auto theme mode for new reader window by @chrox in https://github.com/readest/readest/pull/2238
- font: update font LXGW WenKai to the latest version by @chrox in https://github.com/readest/readest/pull/2240
- fix(tts): scroll more accurately to the highlighted text in TTS when header/footer bars are shown by @chrox in https://github.com/readest/readest/pull/2242
- compat(tts): fix crash with TTS on some versions of Android systems by @chrox in https://github.com/readest/readest/pull/2244
- release: version 0.9.87 by @chrox in https://github.com/readest/readest/pull/2245
Full Changelog: https://github.com/readest/readest/compare/v0.9.86...v0.9.87
